intro: Dombeya ambongensis var. ihosyensis, commonly known as the Ihosy dombeya, is a shrub native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas. Its leaves are simple, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and restricted distribution.
